link.synopsis: The daughter of fitness-conscious parents (William Demarest and Charlotte Greenwood), Katie Higgins (Esther Williams) sets out to become the first woman to swim across the English Channel. While training, she falls for her hunky instructor (Fernando Lamas) and clashes with the event's loudmouthed promoter (Jack Carson). This musical comedy classic from director Charles Walters features Williams swimming with an animated Tom and Jerry.
link.title: synopsis
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
By the Light of the Silvery Moon

link.synopsis: Antifeminist villains don't stand a chance after superficial L.A. bimbo Ophelia (Julia Lee) gets an attitude adjustment from a progressively minded witch and her Council of Superheroines. Soon, the newly reformed Ophelia is on a comical quest to wipe out Virginia Svelte, Cosmetic Chick and others intent on setting back the women's movement. Jurgen Vsych's charming blend of social satire and magical comedy co-stars Hilary Shepard and George Gray.
link.title: synopsis
Surge of Power: The Stuff of Heroes
How to Be a Serial Killer

link.synopsis: A bull terrier named Baxter rids himself of one owner after another in a search for the perfect master in this dark comedy told from the dog's perspective. When the canine meets a young neo-Nazi, Baxter gains a license to vent his growing rage. Empowered by his alienated new owner, Baxter turns into a vicious killer. French director Jérôme Boivin's chilling satire stars Lise Delamare, Jean Mercure and Jacques Spiesser.
link.title: synopsis
Jean de Florette / Manon of the Spring

link.synopsis: Comedienne Laura Kightlinger takes on Hollywood as Jackie Woodman, an underemployed showbiz writer who roams La-La Land in search of life, love and a buyer for her roller derby screenplay in this witty, cynical comedy series from IFC. Nicholle Tom co-stars as Jackie's wacky best friend and partner in crime, Tara, a fellow wannabe industry player. Guest stars in the debut season include Sally Kellerman and Andy Dick.

link.synopsis: Sigalit Fuchs scored an Israeli Academy Award for her winning performance as Simcha, an office worker who lands a role on the therapeutic reality show "Gotta Be Happy," which requires her to throw a surprise party for her long-suffering family. Amid these adventures, Simcha also entertains a romance with a tiny mime. Rivka Michaeli and Yossi Pollak co-star as Simcha's depressed parents in this quirky comedy drama set in Tel Aviv.

link.synopsis: Struggling actor Danny (Adam Baratta) and his pal Stuart (Shane Edelman) are ready to rock the L.A. nightlife -- with help from a Rolls Royce and Rolex "borrowed" from Stuart's uncle Manny, a big-time producer. But plans go awry when the boys meet the too-good-to-be-true Jenny (Kari Wuhrer). The mysterious hottie pulls a major fast one on Danny and Stuart, prompting a zany chase through the City of Angels in this ingratiating indie comedy.

Extras include "The South Bay Boys" original sketch show, directed by Barnhart and starring graduates of the Second City Conservatory, and a sneak peek at Barnhart's short film "What Are the Odds?"

link.synopsis: Fed up with being virgins, four buddies (Bruno Ascenzo, Oscar Beltrán, Jason Day and José Manuel Peláez) pool their money and hire a trio of sexy female escorts (Angie Jibaja, Melania Urbina and Milene Vásquez) to school them in the ways of love. The fact that it all takes place on Halloween night? Well, that only adds a little excitement to the festivities. Eduardo Mendoza de Echave directs this Spanish-language sex comedy.

link.synopsis: Life turns upside down for a humble everyman when he's mistaken for a wealthy bank president who's in serious trouble with the law. True, he now has everything he could possibly want. But he also has more problems than he's prepared to deal with. Luis José Germán, Irvin Alberti, Cuquín Victoria, Nurin Sanlley and Karina Larrauri co-star in this Spanish-language comedy from director Jorge De Bernardi.
link.title: synopsis
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai

link.synopsis: In The History Channel's hit comedy series "Mail Call," Marine Corps veteran turned actor R. Lee Ermey answers viewers' questions about the military and how it works. Collected here are the funniest unplanned moments and gaffes from the show. This never-before-seen compilation of bloopers is presented in two formats: the "X-Tra Salty" uncensored version and a tamer, family-friendly edition.

link.synopsis: Ram (Rishi Kapoor) suspects his wife, Seeta (Jayapradha), is getting a tad too comfortable with his younger brother Amar (Govinda), and the suspicions persist even after Amar marries his girlfriend, Asha (Farha Naaz). Distraught, Ram turns to drink and gets cozy with a childhood friend, Deepa. Meanwhile, Ram and Amar's domineering mother (Shashikala) pushes Amar to find a richer woman to marry in this tense Bollywood comedy drama.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Barry Evans plays multiple roles and stars with Liz Fraser in this ribald British sex comedy about a handsome young doctor, his beautiful female patients and their sexual hang-ups. Dr. Boyd is highly successful because his luscious clients are eager to discuss their most intimate issues with him. Trouble is, their enthusiastic confessions may also be the source of his downfall as the young physician tries to keep his own carnal urges in check.

When he acquires a classy independent movie at a film festival, he dreams of success but discovers that his reputation precedes him at every turn. Kathleen Robertson, James A. Woods, Trevor Hayes and Nicolas Wright co-star in the first season of this satirical comedy about the pitfalls of the wrong kind of success.

link.synopsis: There's more than sibling rivalry in 10-year-old Haré's distrust of his new adopted sister, Guu. He knows her secret: She's a shape-shifting alien who consumes anything and everything in her path. In fact, there's an entire population of weird creatures living in her stomach. But she still finds time to be the perfect bratty sister, making life miserable for Haré by pointing out his numerous character flaws in this offbeat anime comedy.

link.synopsis: Spreading joy throughout the galaxy, hapless Capt. Slosh and his quirky crew transport beer across the universe in their spaceship. But it's hardly smooth sailing as they deal with evil aliens, stowaways and more. Created in 1983 by a group of Disney co-workers and shot in their homes, this campy sci-fi comedy stars Mark Delle, Frank Delle and Ron Cookson. Extras include a newly remastered "sober" version and a fascinating making-of documentary.

link.synopsis: Down on their luck, newlyweds Jack and Peggy (Ian Carmichael and Janette Scott) buy a decrepit houseboat. To their dismay, they soon discover that their "home" requires tons of work and, unfortunately, so do their sailing skills. After struggling to make the vessel seaworthy, they take another couple out for a short trip, only to become hopelessly lost. This classic British comedy co-stars Sid James and Liz Fraser.

link.synopsis: Comedians Jaswinder Bhalla, Bal Mukand Sharma and Neelu star in this sketch variety show. Interspersed with the trio's hilarious satirical skits are musical performances by singers Sardool Sikander, Surinder Chinda, Balkar Sidhu and others. This 2006 performance by Bhalla, Sharma and Neelu marks the 25th anniversary of the Chhankata series of comedy shows.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Hypochondriac Ghuggi (Gurpreet Ghuggi) overhears another patient's prognosis and believes he's got only a short time to live. Expecting his wife (Upasana Singh) to soon be a widow, he encourages a visiting college friend, Sikander (Smeep Kang), to put the moves on her. Vivek Shauq co-stars in this uproarious comedy from director Ksshitij Choudhary.

link.synopsis: Down-and-out Raja encounters not one but two magic genies in this romantic comedy. After a few disasters, Raja tries to get rid of the pesky genies, but when the lovely Nisha is kidnapped, Raja realizes he may need their magic to save her. Do the troublemaking genies have what it takes to save Nisha, and does Raja have what it takes to find true love without a little magic? Rajesh Khanna, Shammi Kapoor and Johnny Walker star.
link.title: synopsis
The Fall of the Roman Empire: Deluxe Edition

link.synopsis: A gay man with a tall order for a lover searches for the perfect mate and winds up finding much more in this romantic comedy. Jaime (Brian Campbell) scours Chicago for a straight guy willing to turn gay just to be with him, a journey that leads to self-discovery. Along the way, Jaime encounters all kinds of colorful characters and gorgeous hunks and learns the surprising truth about love, acceptance and what it takes to be happy.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them

link.synopsis: The Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling light up the screen on and off the mat in this collection of the best-loved episodes of all time. Volume 4 includes three sexy matches and a thrilling GLOW-on-GLOW Street Fight, plus dozens of hilarious comedy skits. Sketches include "MTV's GLOW Connection" and "GLOW House Arrest"; matches include Justice vs. Big Bad Mama, Vicky Victory vs. Daisy, and Cheyenne Cher & Vicky Victory vs. Beastie & Habana.

link.synopsis: The Rap Click Gang has a name but nothing else, not even talent or songs. When the group's leader, Money (Peter Ramirez), hears of a radio station contest with a recording contract as a prize, he swipes a rival group's song and submits it as his own. Now, that group's front man (Noel Gugliemi) is out for a little payback. Ismael Vidrio and Queenie co-star in this comedy about the quest for fame.

link.synopsis: Hired by a business owner (Peter Gantzler) to portray a fictitious CEO, a washed-up actor (Jens Albinus) finds himself caught up in sleazy buyout negotiations and the shady side of big business in Lars von Trier's dark comedy. In order to give a realistic performance as the nonexistent company figurehead, the actor must compromise his own scruples. Fridrik Thor Fridriksson and Benedikt Erlingsson co-star.

link.synopsis: In this hybrid comedy documentary, Hollywood actor Jeff Goldblum (playing himself) tries his hand at regional theater by staging a production of "The Music Man" starring Ed Begley Jr., Illeana Douglas and other well-known actors. Filmmakers Chris Bradley and Kyle LaBrache deliberately blur the line between reality and fiction as Goldblum and his troupe prepare for their opening in his hometown of Pittsburgh.

Shows include a woman (Amanda Abbington) who dons silly outfits to get her husband's (Nicholas Burns) approval, a guy (Ben Crompton) who sobs so much, his ex-girlfriend (Daisy Haggard) can't understand him and more. Nick Frost also stars.

link.synopsis: Working Hollywood actor T.O. (Lawrence B. Adisa) was on his way up -- until his hard-partying lifestyle waylaid his dreams. Now, an important audition gives T.O. a shot at redemption. But he'll have to pull himself together and outdo his rival, Morris (Sam Sarpong). With celebrity friends such as Regina King and French Stewart (both playing themselves) giving him guidance, T.O. works to regain his focus and win the role in this Tinseltown comedy.

link.synopsis: Wealthy, spoiled Rohan (Ruslaan Mumtaz) would rather skip class than study -- that is, until he meets the beautiful and responsible Ayesha (Hazel). Soon, they fall in love, but when Ayesha is forced to move to France, what will become of their relationship? Can Rohan truly change and find a way to win back his first true love? Or will he revert to his selfish habits? This warmhearted romantic comedy also stars Kanwaljit Singh and Rinku Patel.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After losing everything in his divorce, Arthur Givens (Darren Scott) invites his guy friends to his mountain cabin where the men -- removed from their regular routine -- find themselves opening up to one another about women, relationships and sex. Co-director Tom Jenkins and Leonard South's provocative comedy aims to expose the truth about how men really view the opposite sex. David Bickford, Wesley Thompson, Joel Andres and Emil Zidek co-star.

link.synopsis: Jason's idea of romance is planning anonymous gay hookups through a chat room, while his roommate Chad wants to find Mr. Right. When a friend shows Chad how to access the chat room, he meets someone named "Hook-Up Boy" who seems very familiar. The two men are soon falling for each other online, but what will happen when they finally "meet"? Carlos da Silva and Ryan White star in this romantic comedy set in New York.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them

link.synopsis: Five gay men look for friendship and love -- or least a night of fun -- in this racy ensemble comedy about two interconnected love triangles set in San Francisco's famous Castro district. Steven (Adam Gavzer) has eyes only for Blair (Jud Parker), but Blair wants to play the field. Meanwhile, Manny (Alberto Rosas) wants Aaron (Zeke Wheeler) to forget about his commitment to long-distance boyfriend Noel (Andrew Ableson).

link.synopsis: After years of medical school and a successful practice, a physician in midlife crisis discovers that all he really wants to do is direct his own movie. Writer, producer, director and real-life physician Ravi Godse stars in this rib-tickling comedy about a doctor who turns to filmmaking in search of his true calling. But can he cope with immoral agents, threatening mafiosi and an unsupportive wife to create his cinematic vision?

link.synopsis: After a jade pendant is dug up near a failing factory in central China, beleaguered factory chief Xie (Zhonghua Chen) holds an exhibition based on the precious stone. The event attracts lots of attention … from crooks eager to swipe the jewel. This twisty caper comedy -- billed as China's answer to Ocean's Eleven -- also stars Tao Guo as Xie's underfunded security guard, who must rely on a modified urinal sensor to protect the jade.

link.synopsis: What happens when Fidel Castro is banished from Cuba and washes up onshore in Miami? Mixing dark humor and political satire, this comedy explores life in the Cuban-American community where hapless and hated Fidel must try to make a new start. Can he win the people over, or will the refugees who fled his regime have their revenge? Directed and co-written by Alejandro Gonzalez Padilla, the film stars Juan Luis Galiardo and Ofelia Medina.

link.synopsis: Well-known television personality Bob Saget -- perhaps best known for his portrayal of squeaky-clean TV dad Danny Tanner on "Full House" -- headlines an unpredictable evening of adult-flavored comedy in this raucous stand-up special. Highlights include Saget's performance of "Danny Tanner Is Not Gay," a pop parody set to the tune of the Backstreet Boys' "I Want It That Way," and the music video "Rollin' with Saget" featuring Jamie Kennedy.

When the persuasive "cry from the heart" of Herman's lonely men becomes a big-time news story, it unwittingly attracts a swarm of single women from 38 states and four different foreign countries, adding 1,500 residents to the tiny hamlet of 485.

link.synopsis: Everything's going wrong for college freshman Steve (Chad Lowe), a tennis ace whose game has been derailed by his crush on fellow player Shelly (Gail O'Grady). But his luck could change when a buddy suggests he pose as a woman to get closer to the object of his affection. Steve hopes the ruse will make Shelly notice him. Of course, he never imagines she'll discover the truth. … Kim Flowers and Patrick Breen co-star in this cross-dressing comedy.

link.synopsis: Life is good for Maggie Mee (Caroline Quentin) -- until her husband abruptly dumps her for a younger woman, leaving her with no job, no money and two kids. Suddenly, she's thrust back into the workforce and the dating scene in this British comedy series. And though she struggles to get back on her feet, Maggie soon finds that she's having more fun starting her life over than she ever had as a dull, married woman.

link.synopsis: It's the last day of school, and the kids want to party like it's 1999. As the night lingers on, the masks and superficialities of high school social customs give way to fleeting moments of naked reality and beautiful truths. Part of a long tradition of teenage, high school zeitgeist films, this smart comedy delves deeper and renders all the expected characters and clichés with fresh insights and several surprises.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When lovable loser Eddie (John Bryant) misplaces the winning ticket to the $135 million lottery jackpot, he turns to two of his best buddies to help him find it. Soon, the trio embarks on a series of adventures that take them all over Miami's South Beach in pursuit of the missing ticket. Little do the buddies know, however, that Eddie has already made a risky bet with a portion of his winnings in this comedy from director Will Vázquez.

link.synopsis: Jamie Foxx may be a bona fide movie star these days, thanks to his Academy Award-winning turn in Ray, but he never strays far from his comedy roots, as he reminds us in this presentation featuring some of the hottest acts in stand-up. With Cedric the Entertainer serving as host and Foxx's handpicked newcomers -- including Esau McGraw and Donnell Rawlings -- serving up the laughs, this gathering of talent offers  sidesplitting fun.

link.synopsis: In this star-studded comedy, the nephew (Chunky Pandey) of a British don (Gulshan Grover) steals a diamond, setting a Dubai mobster (Arbaaz Khan) and his ragtag gang (Shahid Kapoor and Ayesha Takia) on a collision course with an all-powerful crime boss (Zakir Hussain), a runaway dancer (Sameera Reddy) and a true hero (Sunny Deol). With so many players in the mix, who will ultimately walk off with the precious stone?

Mission Istaanbul: Darr Ke Aagey Jeet Hai
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: It doesn't matter that it's 3 a.m. after a long night of work, a friend is a friend, so when Elvin asks his buddy Fabian to help him move out of his place now (he has to be out by 8 a.m.), his pal agrees. In the five hours that follow, the guys fend off Elvin's ex, her oversized boyfriend, the cops, the neighborhood queen and more in this quirky indie comedy (a winner at the Los Angeles Indie Film Festival) based on true events.

link.synopsis: When neighborhood gangster Mr. Big (Tommy "Tiny" Lister) sends an eviction notice to Miss B's, the gang at the salon will have to put aside the insults and petty drama if they're going to pull together and save the business. Directed by Albert C. Chevalier, this outrageous comedy also stars Marjan Feritous, Eurika Pratts, Johann John Jean, Sierra Schast and Ethel Austin.

link.synopsis: After a divorce leaves Jack "Gator" Gately (Craig Bierko) single, the 35-year-old Bostonian finds himself back in the dating scene -- in an age bracket where the best women are already taken. Luckily, Gator has three newly single pals to help him out. Rashida Jones, Johnny Sneed and Shaun Majumder co-star in this witty, single-camera TV comedy from executive producers Bobby and Peter Farrelly.

link.synopsis: Suburban neighbors Danny (John Ritter) and Linda (Penny Marshall) can't stand each other. But when Danny's wife runs off with Linda's husband, the abandoned spouses must turn to each other for friendship and solace in this romantic comedy directed by Tony Bill. As they try to adjust to their new lives, the two learn to overlook their differences and quirks. Keep in mind the title of this film and you can guess the rest.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: The foibles and fortunes of a simple man and a beautiful princess intersect in this comedy of errors set in the sands of ancient Persia. After donning a disguise to disobey her father's wishes and marry the prince of her dreams (Paul Picerni), Princess Fakzia (Elaine Stewart) crosses paths with the dashing barber Hajji Baba (John Derek), who uncovers her true identity and vows to escort her to the arms of her fiancé.
link.title: synopsis
Captain Kidd and the Slave Girl

link.synopsis: When young advertising exec Paul Bongard (Peter Kastner) gets involved with his attractive female boss, he discovers that the affair has fast-tracked his climb up the corporate ladder. Paul's career gets another boost when he starts up with the boss's daughter. Meanwhile, his childhood sweetheart, Ruth (Louise Sorel), is patiently wondering when, if ever, he'll propose to her in this sex comedy from the early 1970s.
link.title: synopsis
Live a Little, Love a Little
When Every Day Was the 4th of July / The Long Days of Summer: Double Feature
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
Are You Being Served?: The Movie

link.synopsis: Would-be groom Don (Boom Antonio) jilts his fiancée, China (Katrina Halili), at the altar after realizing that he's gay in this Filipino romantic comedy. To mend her broken heart, China washes her hands of men and sets off on a holiday to picturesque Boracay, where she soon meets handsome diving teacher Felix (Alfred Vargas). Is he the man for China, or does life have another surprise in store for her?
link.title: synopsis
Otto; or, Up With Dead People

link.synopsis: Alvin (Rayver Cruz) flies to the Philippines to visit his father, Enrico (Rustom Padilla), and godfather, Louie (Wendell Ramos), who also happen to be undercover lovers. During his stay, Alvin falls for Kristine (Shaina Magdayao) but discovers that her father (Tirso Cruz III) has strict rules about who she can see. But against all odds, love is in the air in this romantic comedy from award-winning director Joel Lamangan.

Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: When his country-dwelling aunt takes to a sick bed, John (Dolphy) and the rest of the Puruntong clan head to the hinterlands for an extended stay. Can the fish-out-of-water family overcome the culture shock of rural life without killing one another? Nida Blanca, Matutina, Rolly Quizon and Maricel Soriano reprise their roles in this Filipino comedy based on the popular 1980s TV series "John and Marsha."
link.title: synopsis
Manila by Night: City After Dark
For Your Height Only / Challenge of the Tiger: Double Feature

link.synopsis: In this imaginative comedy, three college chums launch an underground newspaper (named Gonzo in honor of journalist Hunter S. Thompson) devoted to the counterculture world largely ignored by the mainstream media. But the trio's idealism, friendship and commitment to integrity go down the drain when their private lives get in the way. Meghan Faye Gallagher, Esteban Powell and Justin Shilton head the cast.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When 1950s teenager Jo (Julia Lockwood) publishes a scorching bestseller, her peaceful English town is thrown into an uproar over the thinly veiled references to the residents. As Jo's neighbors begin to look at one another differently, her scandalous writing leads to increasing fame. Based on the play "Book of the Month," this charming comedy comes from Peter Rogers and Gerald Thomas, the team behind the popular British series of Carry On films.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Could Work Miracles
Four Men and a Prayer / Seas Beneath
Monsieur Beaucaire / Where There's Life: Double Feature

link.synopsis: Desperate for help, Leslie (Lisa Kudrow), an overwhelmed working mother trying to raise two unruly boys while her husband fights in Iraq, reluctantly turns to her slacker brother-in-law Salman (portrayed by writer-director Scott Prendergast). Enthusiastic but clueless, Salman makes a mess of caring for the boys, but, anxious to help out, he eventually takes a job as a huge blue corporate mascot in this quirky and touching comedy.
link.title: synopsis
When Did You Last See Your Father?
It's Kind of a Funny Story
The Myth of the American Sleepover

link.synopsis: In this satiric French comedy, two men (Paul Frankeur and Laurent Terzieff) on a spiritual pilgrimage find their faith put to the test by the zealots and apostates they meet along the way. Bernard Verley and Edith Scob provide first-rate support as director Luis Buñuel -- with his trademark absurdist touches on full display -- lampoons his favorite targets: organized religion in general and Catholicism in particular.

The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie

link.synopsis: Pedro Chávez (Pedro Infante) arrives in Mexico City, where he befriends Luis (Luis Aguilar), a cop with the city's elite motorcycle unit. Luis takes Pedro in and finds him a position with the police department and soon discovers he has competition for his job and his girlfriend (Aurora Segura). Infante did all his own motorcycle driving for this musical comedy, which features his signature tune, "Bésame Mucho."

Pedro Infante plays all three roles in this musical comedy directed by frequent Infante collaborator Ismael Rodríguez. Blanca Estela Pavón, María Eugenia Llamas and Fernando Soto co-star.

link.synopsis: In this black comedy, Hollywood makeup artist Marilyn (Kate Hewlett) is thrilled when she gets engaged to TV star Ryan (Paul McGillion), but the situation goes to the dogs when her overprotective brother Patrick (David Hewlett) learns that Marilyn's fiancé is plotting her murder. Things get out of hand when Patrick tries to save his little sister from her killer hubby-to-be, pushing the siblings' tight-knit family to the brink of insanity.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: El (Mauricio Ochmann) is just like his friends, engaging in the time-honored traditions of falling in love, dating, breaking up, making up and breaking up again. Of course, now that he's found the perfect woman, Ella (Ana Serradilla), he expects that this time it'll be for real. Luis Fernando Peña, Ivan Esquivel and Fernanda Castillo co-star in writer-director Eduardo Lucatero's knowing romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Death Beats a Dull Life

link.synopsis: With a surplus of enthusiasm and a serious scarcity of talent, pals Barry and Richard (Jason Jones and Mike Beaver) pursue acting careers in Toronto, an endeavor that turns out to be much harder -- and weirder -- than they expected. Director Warren P. Sonoda's mockumentary, which scored six nominations at the Canadian Comedy Awards, also features hilarious cameos by "Kids in the Hall" alums Dave Foley and Scott Thompson.

link.synopsis: After spotting the obituary of their old classmate Alberto, three 20-something friends attend the funeral, where one of them promptly falls for the sister (Tamara Arias) of the deceased. But as Dani (Javier Pereira) and his pals soon learn, the deceased is not the right Alberto. Set in stunning Barcelona, director María Ripoll's witty and thoughtful comedy picked up a Best Screenplay award for Albert Espinosa at the 2006 Barcelona Film Awards.

link.synopsis: Overweight Ann's (Stephanie Lesh) dreams of becoming a plus-size model start to come true when struggling writer Rick (James Servais) says he can make her into the next big thing. But their plans are sabotaged by Madelynn (Diane Bliss), an obese boutique owner jealous of their romance. Though pretending to help Ann, Madelynn plants seeds of doubts, about both her modeling career and her budding relationship in this unusual romantic comedy.

link.synopsis: Struggling to make ends meet, John (Dolphy) decides to seek his fortune in the United States, with son Rolly (Rolly Quizon) in tow. After narrowly avoiding deportation, he takes a job in a factory, unaware that it's a front for one of the country's biggest drug rings. Nida Blanca and Maricel Soriano reprise their roles in this cross-cultural comedy based on the hit series "John and Marsha."

link.synopsis: The Philippines' biggest stars shine in this anthology series. Each episode features melodrama, comedy and romance with a twist of horror, science fiction or fairy tale thrown in for good measure. A young boy is saved from drowning by a mermaid, an orphan gives her adopted family a magical leg up in the restaurant business, a man searching for the girl of his dreams discovers a vampire clan and a novelist is haunted by his true love's ghost.

link.synopsis: D.L. Hughley proved he was unapologetic when he threw his own provocative remarks into the already fiery debate over Don Imus and the Rutgers University women's basketball team. That's why the title of his first HBO special is especially fitting. Weighing in on a variety of hot topics, from the current political climate to the life and death of Anna Nicole Smith, he never fails to hit a nerve with his brand of in-your-face comedy.

link.synopsis: The eccentric lives of ham radio enthusiasts collide when their signals -- and alter egos -- get crossed, and two of them fall in love. The problem is, they haven't truly fallen in love with each other but rather with their imaginary personas. The quirky characters in this unconventional romantic comedy include a Welsh priest, a Russian cosmonaut and a paranoid conspiracy theorist who thinks everyone's out to get her.

link.synopsis: Everything the people of Putterton cherish is jeopardized when a beautiful tax agent named Caroline Roy (Valérie Valois) comes to town. Putterton's only hope of retaining its idyllic charm rests with quiet, unassuming local George Putter (Billy Zane). Co-written and directed by Alain Zaloum, this charming romantic comedy also stars Michael Sinelnikoff, Gordon Masten, Serge Houde, Patrick Bergin and Barry Morse.

link.synopsis: Stage and screen star Fanny Brice -- the charismatic chanteuse famously portrayed by Barbra Streisand in Funny Girl and later in Funny Lady -- steals the show in this 1930s comedy about a nightclub singer who falls for a boxer (Robert Armstrong). Five rousing musical numbers include "When a Woman Loves a Man," a song co-written by Brice's husband, famed lyricist Billy Rose.

link.synopsis: Faced with the choice of winning a company-sponsored talent show or losing their jobs, a pair of desperate colleagues learns the art of Chinese lion dancing -- a ritual not to be confused with line dancing -- and unwittingly spark a citywide craze. Co-director Francis Ng also stars along with Chi Chung Lam and Anthony Wong Chau-Sang in this lighthearted Hong Kong comedy in the spirit of Strictly Ballroom.

Also featured are a slew of laugh-out-loud works, including the opening of the Geek Boy serial movie and two gamer-bashing commercials for G4 (from Buck). link.synopsis: Jed (Ryan Agoncillo) is on the brink of leaving the Philippines to join his family in America when a run-in with the perfect woman, Angie (Judy Ann Santos), changes everything. A speedy proposal sends both families reeling and sets the stage for a rocky marriage. This romantic comedy from director and co-writer Jose Javier Reyes also stars Gloria Diaz, Gina Pareño, Ariel Ureta, Juliana Palermo and Derek Ramsey.

link.synopsis: After his girlfriend, Kailin (Agnes Sahagun), asks for more space, heartbroken college kid Charlie (Stephen Heraldo) tries to pick up the pieces during Christmas break with the help of his buddy Lewis (Chuong Tran). Just when it seems Charlie has turned a corner, he meets beautiful and sassy Jesse. Writer-director Bernard Badion's charming no-budget romantic comedy stars a largely Filipino-American cast of nonprofessional actors.

link.synopsis: Funnyman Orny Adams's debut stand-up film features riffs on phone sex, kids with guns, strong women and hair loss in this hysterical performance recorded at Pasadena, California's famed Ice House Comedy Club. The comic has never held a 9-to-5 job, and this show demonstrates why the corporate world is exactly the wrong place for him. Bonus footage includes clips of Adams struggling to entertain a crowd of non-English speakers in Fiji.

link.synopsis: Divorced and depressed Yvonne (Sylvia Chang) seems doomed to never find happiness, until Mexican-American dentist Jose (Esai Morales) enters her life. But when Yvonne's traditional Chinese family refuses to accept their romance, her chance at true love is jeopardized. Can the couple overcome racial prejudices and cultural boundaries and win her family's approval? Co-written and directed by Frank Lin, this touching comedy also stars Pat Morita.

link.synopsis: Lifelong pals Vince (Joe Narciso), Nick (Nicholas Giordano) and Eddie (Kevin Kash) are all married and secretly in love with their fourth childhood friend, the beautiful and single Laura (Elizabeth Regen), still very available in this blue-collar comedy from director Stan Schofield. When Laura makes a drunken toast at Vince's wedding, the long-simmering attractions overheat, and the trio must reevaluate their marriages.

Celebrating the Art of the Short Film

link.synopsis: In Daniel Kollo Sanou's comedy, Sogo (Mamadou Zerbo), a West African World War II vet, purchases a mill on credit believing he'd get paid his due pension. But when the money doesn't come through, Sogo finds himself in jail for not being able to pay off the mill. Having already waited over 50 years for his pension, Sogo joins in with the local women who come to his side in support.

link.synopsis: Poor ranch hand José Francisco (Tito Guízar) falls in love with homely girl turned beauty Cruz (Esther Fernández). Unfortunately, his boss, rancher Felipe (René Cardona), also adores her, and the resulting love triangle threatens José's job and their friendship. Director Fernando de Fuentes's romance launched the comedia ranchera genre, which combines Mexican folklore with musical comedy and melodrama.

Put in the position of casting the tie-breaking vote for the locale of the senior class's graduation trip, will Jaime opt to party hearty on the Spanish coast or side with Marta's contingent, which would rather go to highbrow Paris?

link.synopsis: In this insightful interview, veteran dramatist Nick Kazan shares his know-how about handling studio script notes, integrating changes without sacrificing the material and developing screenwriting chops. The Oscar-nominated writer of the films Reversal of Fortune (1990), Frances (1982), At Close Range (1986) and Patty Hearst (1988) also explains why he doesn't "do lunch" and why he views life as a comedy.

link.synopsis: Who says cops need to toe the line? Not Malcolm Cain (Terrence Flack) and John Abel (Shane Woodson), two detectives who push the envelope while enforcing the law in this 1970s-inspired comedy. When a new lieutenant takes over, they must fend off his efforts to oust them. Flavor Flav makes a cameo as the hilarious Slim Jim.

link.synopsis: The Wiggles use their trademark comedy, music and dance to spread holiday cheer in this lively program for preschoolers. Join the Aussie foursome as they sing traditional carols and their own original tunes, and learn new dance moves along the way. Songs include "Jingle Bells," "Christmas Around the World," "Here Come the Reindeer," "Christmas Samba" and "Angels We Have Heard on High."

link.synopsis: In this hit French comedy, jobless loner Eddie Vuibert (Richard Anconina) gets a lucky break when a rich Jewish entrepreneur mistakes him for a Jew and gives him a sweet job in the Parisian fashion district. Awash in champagne, fancy cars and beautiful women, Eddie finds himself hanging by a thread as he fakes his way through Sephardic culture and the fashion industry. Scene-stealing José Garcia co-stars as Eddie's clowning pal Serge.

link.synopsis: Beautiful, sexy ad executive Trixie (Rufa Mae Quinto) is consumed with her career and ignores love. When she spurns the attention of three men -- Dennis, Jeff and Buboy -- their arrogance compels them to assault her, leading to a deadly accident. But her ghost refuses to accept the situation; instead, Trixie's spirit conjures a plan for payback, haunting her three attackers until justice is served in this dark comedy.

link.synopsis: Four fantastically funny female comedians -- Etta May, Trish Suhr, Sonya White and Beth Donahue -- share their views on life in middle America in this live stand-up show recorded before a sold-out crowd in Lexington, Kentucky's historic opera house. The Southern Fried Chicks are one of the most popular acts on the comedy circuit, and this one-hour show, which first aired on CMT, features the quartet's best jokes about love, politics and family.

link.synopsis: Starring the popular characters from the GEICO insurance ads, this offbeat comedy follows three urbane modern-day Neanderthals struggling to gain acceptance in a world all too willing to make judgments based on their primitive appearance. By all other measures, Joel (Bill English), Nick (Nick Kroll) and Andy (Sam Huntington) are just your average dudes -- chasing girls, playing cards, watching the game. If only evolution hadn't passed them by ...

link.synopsis: Judy Greer stars as Becky Freeley, a quirky high school guidance counselor who's just landed a job at her alma mater. Produced by actor Ashton Kutcher, this lighthearted comedy also stars Brooke Burns, Earl Billings, Kristoffer Polaha and Jonathan Sadowski.

link.synopsis: When their chartered boat flips and dumps them into the ocean, four executives who signed up for a team-building exercise find themselves stranded on a deserted island with plenty of corporate know-how but no real survival skills to speak of. Timothy Spall, Martin Clunes, David Bamber and Jeff Rawle co-star in this British comedy from award-winning screenwriter Tim Firth (Calendar Girls, Kinky Boots).

link.synopsis: Joshua Cary, Bryan Fenkart and David Ledoux star in this indie romantic comedy as best friends and serial daters who are so used to asking each other for advice about the women they're seeing that they've forgotten how to listen to their own hearts. That could explain why they're still single … but there's also the fact that one of them is a birthday clown. Cary, Fenkart and Ledoux also conceived, wrote and directed the film.

link.synopsis: Taking his cues from adult-flavored cartoons such as "South Park" and "Beavis and Butt-Head," Mexican director Juan Miguel Figueroa delivers a provocative animated comedy about a teen named Vito who wants desperately to lose his virginity. Vito's string of misadventures takes him to a seedy establishment with rooms that can be rented by the hour … but that's only the beginning of his hilarious sexual awakening.

link.synopsis: Upon falling in love with the beautiful sister (Shriya) of a wealthy business tycoon (Prakash Raj), Thiru (Dhanush) appeals to the brother's business sense by striking a lucrative deal for the girl's affections. But is getting what he wants really as simple as it seems? Bhoopathy Pandian directs this Tamil-language romantic comedy with music by D. Imman. Mouli and Saranya also star.

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, womanizing college student Sang-min (Rae-won Kim) is happy to be young and single. But his bachelor days are numbered when his family arranges his marriage to Bo-eun (Geun-yeong Mun), his childhood friend -- and a high school teenager. Bo-eun's not thrilled either: She's got her eye on the school jock. Now, married out of respect for their families, the two must find a way to live together while living separate lives.

link.synopsis: When fair-skinned Alain (Pasha Brandt) falls for black Creole Minoushka (Milca Volny), their family and friends are not at all happy about the romance. And the cozier the two get, the more determined their disapproving loved ones become on splitting them up. NikkiMix, Dadou Pasquet, Marie Felix Lemite and Aubry Blague co-star in this charming romantic comedy set in South Florida's Creole community.

link.synopsis: In this World War II comedy, Marine sergeant James O'Hearn (Burt Lancaster), absent from his post during the attack on Pearl Harbor, is branded a coward. But during his court-martial, the circumstances surrounding his absence come to light and form a remarkable tale. Flashbacks reveal how O'Hearn's attempt to stop a fellow Marine's (Chuck Connors) wedding strands both men in Shanghai, where they're besieged in combat of their own.

link.synopsis: Simon (Jean Yanne) has only one friend, a cop named Mickey (Yvon Back). When Mickey is shot and killed, Simon drops his simple life as a salesman to make vengeance his full-time job. Tracking down small-time hood Marx (Jean-Louis Trintignant) and his dim-witted sidekick Johnny (Mathieu Kassovitz), Simon finds a new life for himself in his friend's death. Bulle Ogier co-stars in this wry black comedy, winner of three César Awards.

link.synopsis: Ripley Holden (Lloyd Owen) gambles everything he has on the chance to become a big-time casino boss in Laughlin, Nev. His money runs out, his family's ready to rebel and his business partner is suspiciously murdered. It's all part of the game to happy-go-lucky Ripley, but with this much at stake, optimism may not be enough. Mädchen Amick co-stars in this musical comedy drama, adapted from the hit BBC series "Viva Blackpool."
